Organs/Tissues: Patient-derived cancer organoids (breast, lung, Ewing sarcoma, etc.) in microfluidic droplets
Physiological/Pathological: Pathological tumor model (PDOs). Also supports healthy/stem-cell lines, but main use is cancer drug testing
Cell Source: Primary tumor cells (biopsies), also cell lines or iPSCs. Possible 1–3 cell-type co-culture
Multiple Cell Types: Yes, can incorporate tumor + stromal fibroblasts ± immune cells in same droplet
Tissue-resident Immune: Possible (tumor-associated macrophages from patient sample) if included
Circulating Immune: Yes, T/NK cells can be added to test immunotherapy response
Crosstalk (Multi-tissue): No multi-organ linking, single-tumor environment in each droplet
Air-Liquid Interface: No, organoids fully submerged in droplet
Extracellular Matrix: Possible hydrogel embed or self-assembly spheroids in microfluidic droplets
3D Scaffold: Organoids form scaffold-free or minimal matrix droplet environment
Notable Features: Microfluidic droplet array, high-throughput screening of 100s–1000s organoids & multiple drugs. Co-culture & real-time imaging
Plate/Format (Throughput): Custom chip (1 device) can run 100–800 conditions, ~1000 organoids. Very high throughput
Max Culture Duration: Days (up to ~1 week) for organoid formation & drug response
Readouts - Live Imaging: Yes, integrated automated microscopy for each droplet. AI-based analysis
Readouts - Supernatant Sampling: Not typically, droplets are closed microenvironments
Readouts - Cell Retrieval: Possible but not standard (droplet-based, complicated to extract organoids)
Readouts - Whole Tissue: Small spheroids, typically imaged in situ. No large tissue retrieval
Dead Volume: Minimal, nanoliter droplets. Very efficient use of cells/reagents
Perfused: Not continuous flow. Microfluidics used for droplet generation & merging, but static culture inside droplets
Gas Mix Controlled: Standard incubator conditions, chip possibly gas-permeable
Real-time Microenvironment Control: Yes, can add compounds or immune cells by droplet merging steps. Not continuous perfusion
model_availability: Product-based. Okomera sells the instrument/chips for in-lab high-throughput testing
